summary: The Accelerating Broadband Permits Act aims to expedite the processing of applications for communications use, specifically focusing on broadband infrastructure projects. It mandates executive agencies to improve the accuracy of data tracking application processing times, analyze delay factors, take corrective actions, and provide annual reports to relevant congressional committees. Additionally, the bill amends the FAST Act to include infrastructure projects costing over $5 million that are subject to NEPA and involve broadband construction.
